alert.note: Alert for Juneau (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued October 27 at 7:46PM CDT until November 01 at 2:30PM CDT by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Wisconsin... Black River Near Galesville affecting La Crosse and Trempealeau Counties. Black River at Black River Falls affecting Jackson County. Yellow River at Necedah affecting Juneau County. .Excessive rainfall this past week over the Black and Yellow River basins has led to sharp river rises and flooding. While the Black River has crested, the Yellow river is on the rise and the flood crest is moving toward Necedah. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM SATURDAY AFTERNOON TO EARLY WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Yellow River at Necedah. * WHEN...From Saturday afternoon to early Wednesday afternoon. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:00 PM CDT Friday the stage was 12.5 feet. - Bankfull stage is 13.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage tomorrow afternoon to a crest of 16.5 feet early Monday morning. It will then fall below flood stage late Tuesday evening. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 16.6 feet on 05/21/2017. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional river and weather information is available at www.weather.gov/lacrosse. The next statement will be issued Saturday morning at 1145 AM CDT.
